abstract: Warren E. Buffett’s company, Berkshire Hathaway, sold a fair portion of its stakes in Johnson & Johnson and Proctor & Gamble late last year in order to help pay for its acquisition of Burlington Northern Santa Fe.
snippet: Warren E. Buffett’s company, Berkshire Hathaway, sold a fair portion of its stakes in Johnson & Johnson and Proctor & Gamble late last year in order to help pay for its acquisition of Burlington Northern Santa Fe.
lead_paragraph: Warren E. Buffett really wanted to own the world’s largest train set. His company, Berkshire Hathaway, sold a fair portion of its stakes in Johnson & Johnson and Procter & Gamble late last year in order to help pay for its acquisition of Burlington Northern Santa Fe.

headline.main: What Buffett Sold to Pay for His Railroad
